title: The Bachelorette: Kyle Sandilands asks Angie Kent if there are any 'blacks'
text:
He recently faced a media firestorm after joking about the Virgin Mary.

And Kyle Sandilands made another on-air gaffe on Wednesday, when he asked The Bachelorette's Angie Kent about the ethnic diversity of her suitors.

During a live interview on The Kyle and Jackie O Show, he asked: 'Was there any black men in there? Did they throw in a few blacks for you?'

Oh, dear! Kyle Sandilands (left) made another on-air gaffe on Wednesday, when he asked Angie Kent (right) if The Bachelorette producers 'threw in a few blacks' for her to choose from

'I asked for all shapes and sizes!' Angie replied.

Kyle then asked if casting producers had invited 'a wheelchair person' to audition for the show, referring to disabled people.

'No, they didn't,' Angie replied.

Hard-hitting questions: Kyle also asked Angie if there was a 'wheelchair person' in the cast

'Did they bring any different shades of race in?' Kyle asked again.

'Yeah!' Angie responded, to which Kyle replied: 'Okay, good.'

'I don't pick the guys that come in, they're cast for me,' she added.

The former Gogglebox star has previously said she is attracted to mixed-race men, but doesn't discriminate on the basis of a person's ethnicity.

Diverse cast: This year, The Bachelorette will welcome Sri Lankan-born Niranga Amarasinghe, who recently told The Huffington Post he wants to be 'more than the brown guy' this season

'I love culture, that's what I'm looking for,' she told TV Week in April.

'I'm generally attracted to mixed-race guys, but I don't want people to think I won't date white guys. I want there to be a variety of people. I don't want an all-white cast, that's not what I'm into.'

The Bachelorette premieres Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
